title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string (e.g., '55/66/9999') is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted. The following definition shows up in the report design:<parameters><scalarparameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>
EB: The BIRT report designer should reject any invalid date/time string entered in the 'default value' field for a 'DateTime' type report parameter.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of 'DateTime' type.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date/time string (e.g., '55/66/9999').
4. Save the report design.

Expected result: The BIRT report designer should reject the invalid date/time string and display an error message.
